headline.main: CUBAN NAMED TO U.N.; Envoy Ousted by Uruguay Will Represent Havana

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 7 -- An investigating commission of the Organization of American States arrived here today to investigate charges that the Dominican Government is dictatorial and oppressive.
docs.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 7 -- An investigating commission of the Organization of American States arrived here today to investigate charges that the Dominican Government is dictatorial and oppressive.
docs.abstract: OAS mission arrives; Govt decrees protection for citizens who denounce 'arbitrary conduct' or 'abuse of power' by Govt officials; stresses const rights; Trujillo Jr issues similar decree for armed forces

headline.main: O.A.S. UNIT OPENS DOMINICAN STUDY; ASSURANCE GIVEN; 4-Nation Board Arrives -- Regime Vows Protection to Denouncers of Abuse O.A.S. UNIT OPENS DOMINICAN VISIT

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 7 -- Adlai E. Stevenson, President Kennedy's special envoy, conferred with President Arturo Frondizi privately today on economic development and inter-American problems.

docs.abstract: Exile groups, Buenos Aires, seek ints with Amb Stevenson to tell him of pol repression

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CIUDAD TRUJILLO, Dominican Republic, June 8 -- A high army officer was said today to have been involved in the plot that ended in assassination of Generalissimo Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina on May 30. The officer's name has not been disclosed.

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., June 8 -- One of the tiniest golfers in the women's professional ranks, Mrs. Marlene Bauer Hagge, gained a sizable lead as the Triangle round-robin started at the Wykagyl Country Club today.

headline.main: WITNESSES LEAVE CIUDAD TRUJILLO; Two Departures Coincide With Start of Inquiry

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 9 -- A broad new collective approach to the problem posed by Cuba for the inter-American system is emerging from Adlai E. Stevenson's conversations with Latin-American chiefs of state.

headline.main: STEVENSON'S TRIP DEVELOPING UNITY; Approach to Cuba Emerging -- Envoy in Montevideo

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 10 -- Adlai E. Stevenson, President Kennedy's personal envoy on a tour of Latin-American nations, was assured tonight that President Janio Quadros of Brazil shares Mr. Kennedy's conviction that "liberty in America is linked to...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 10 -- Adlai E. Stevenson, President Kennedy's personal envoy on a tour of Latin-American nations, was assured tonight that President Janio Quadros of Brazil shares Mr. Kennedy's conviction that "liberty in America is linked to democratic stability."
docs.abstract: Min Arinos de Melo Franco says Brazil shares Kennedy and Stevenson views on unity and amity of Hemisphere, s, Rio de Janeiro
